title: I just peel the stickers off!

data.title: I just peel the stickers off!
data.statement:
Can a Rubik's cube be solved by Restickering™?

A popular method to pretend you can solve the Rubik's cube when no one's watching is to peel the stickers off and glue them back into place.  It's not a very good method, as it tends to damage the stickers irreparably, but from a theoretical point of view it does the job.

Feliks has left his scrambled cube on the table for only a few minutes, but as he comes back from his break, he notices an evil grin on Lucas's face.  Has Lucas been messing around with the cube and spare stickers in a way that makes it unsolvable using the Restickering™ method?  Help Feliks by telling him whether or not he can peel and glue the stickers back into place.

You are given a cube state in pattern format.  A solved cube looks like this:
`
    UUU
    UUU
    UUU

LLL FFF RRR BBB
LLL FFF RRR BBB
LLL FFF RRR BBB

    DDD
    DDD
    DDD
`
Letters {{ULFRBD}} mean “this sticker belongs on the Up/‌Left/‌Front/‌Right/‌Back/‌Down face”.

A monochrome cube, e.g. with only {{U}} stickers, is obviously unsolvable using the Restickering™ method.

A cube where an {{R′}} move (right face counterclockwise quarter turn, in standard notation) has been applied is solvable using the Restickering™ method and looks like the example below.

testCases.title: R′
testCases.testIn:
UUB
    UUB
    UUB

LLL FFU RRR DBB
LLL FFU RRR DBB
LLL FFU RRR DBB

    DDF
    DDF
    DDF

testCases.title: L
testCases.testIn:
BUU
    BUU
    BUU

LLL UFF RRR BBD
LLL UFF RRR BBD
LLL UFF RRR BBD

    FDD
    FDD
    FDD

testCases.title: Solved
testCases.testIn:
UUU
    UUU
    UUU

LLL FFF RRR BBB
LLL FFF RRR BBB
LLL FFF RRR BBB

    DDD
    DDD
    DDD

testCases.title: x2
testCases.testIn:
DDD
    DDD
    DDD

LLL BBB RRR FFF
LLL BBB RRR FFF
LLL BBB RRR FFF

    UUU
    UUU
    UUU

testCases.title: Pure White
testCases.testIn:
UUU
    UUU
    UUU

UUU UUU UUU UUU
UUU UUU UUU UUU
UUU UUU UUU UUU

    UUU
    UUU
    UUU

testCases.title: Pure Yellow
testCases.testIn:
DDD
    DDD
    DDD

DDD DDD DDD DDD
DDD DDD DDD DDD
DDD DDD DDD DDD

    DDD
    DDD
    DDD

testCases.title: L2 D R′ D′ F′ D′ R D′ R2 F2
testCases.testIn:
DUD
    DUU
    BDL

LLL UFF ULR FBF
LLR BFF URB DBF
FRD BUU BFB DBR

    LRR
    DDR
    ULR

testCases.title: M2 E2 S2
testCases.testIn:
UDU
    DUD
    UDU

LRL FBF RLR BFB
RLR BFB LRL FBF
LRL FBF RLR BFB

    DUD
    UDU
    DUD

testCases.title: UF edge flip
testCases.testIn:
UUU
    UUU
    UFU

LLL FUF RRR BBB
LLL FFF RRR BBB
LLL FFF RRR BBB

    DDD
    DDD
    DDD

testCases.title: UF edge flip on L2 D R′ D′ F′ D′ R D′ R2 F2
testCases.testIn:
DUD
    DUU
    BFL

LLL UDF ULR FBF
LLR BFF URB DBF
FRD BUU BFB DBR

    LRR
    DDR
    ULR

testCases.title: UFR corner twist
testCases.testIn:
UUU
    UUU
    UUF

LLL FFR URR BBB
LLL FFF RRR BBB
LLL FFF RRR BBB

    DDD
    DDD
    DDD

testCases.title: UFR corner twist on  L2 D R′ D′ F′ D′ R D′ R2 F2
testCases.testIn:
DUD
    DUU
    BDF

LLL UFU LLR FBF
LLR BFF URB DBF
FRD BUU BFB DBR

    LRR
    DDR
    ULR

testCases.title: Random stickers
testCases.testIn:
LRD
    DFR
    RBD

ULF LRB DBD LLB
RLL BUU BFD FFU
BDR URL UDF RFL

    FBU
    LRU
    DFU

testCases.title: Other random stickers
testCases.testIn:
UFD
    URL
    UBF

LFR FDU LRU RDB
UFF DFB UUB LLR
BLL DBD BRL FLU

    DBR
    RFD
    DRL

testCases.title: More random stickers
testCases.testIn:
BDL
    DBL
    LUR

BFR BBD LUFDUR
UBR RRD DLDFUR
RBF FUU FRFBFD

    UBF
    LLD
    LUR

testCases.title: More other random stickers
testCases.testIn:
UUR
    RBL
    FDB

LLU DBD URD LFU
UFR FDB ULB DBR
FFL RLF BLB BLD

    LUF
    FRD
    URR

data.constraints:
Apart from the stickering, all cubes are standard 3×3×3 Rubik's cubes.
Only valid sticker colors are provided.
data.outputDescription:
{{SOLVABLE}} if it is possible to peel the stickers off and glue them back in a solved cube.
{{UNSOLVABLE}} otherwise.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Can a Rubik's cube be solved by Restickering™?

A popular method to pretend you can solve the Rubik's cube when no one's watching is to peel the stickers off and glue them back into place. It's not a very good method, as it tends to damage the stickers irreparably, but from a theoretical point of view it does the job.

Feliks has left his scrambled cube on the table for only a few minutes, but as he comes back from his break, he notices an evil grin on Lucas's face. Has Lucas been messing around with the cube and spare stickers in a way that makes it unsolvable using the Restickering™ method? Help Feliks by telling him whether or not he can peel and glue the stickers back into place.

You are given a cube state in pattern format. A solved cube looks like this:

    UUU
    UUU
    UUU

LLL FFF RRR BBB
LLL FFF RRR BBB
LLL FFF RRR BBB

    DDD
    DDD
    DDD

Letters ULFRBD mean “this sticker belongs on the Up/‌Left/‌Front/‌Right/‌Back/‌Down face”.

A monochrome cube, e.g. with only U stickers, is obviously unsolvable using the Restickering™ method.

A cube where an R′ move (right face counterclockwise quarter turn, in standard notation) has been applied is solvable using the Restickering™ method and looks like the example below.
Input
11 lines (including 2 blank): a cube pattern
Output
SOLVABLE if it is possible to peel the stickers off and glue them back in a solved cube.
UNSOLVABLE otherwise.
Constraints
Apart from the stickering, all cubes are standard 3×3×3 Rubik's cubes.
Only valid sticker colors are provided.
Example
Input
    UUB
    UUB
    UUB

LLL FFU RRR DBB
LLL FFU RRR DBB
LLL FFU RRR DBB

    DDF
    DDF
    DDF
Output
SOLVABLE
